articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Cuban Embassy to Express Condolences over Demise of Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Cuban Embassy to Express Condolences over Demise of Fidel Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Cuban embassy here on Monday to express deep condolences over the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, and Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 Laid there was a wreath sent by he over the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 He paid silent tribute to Fidel Castro Ruz in memory of him together with officials accompanying him.
					
					 He made an entry in the mourner's book as follows:
					
					 "Though the outstanding leader passed away, his name and feats will always be remembered by all of us.
					
					 We feel pain of the loss of the great Comrade, the great comrade-in-arms.
					
					 Kim Jong Un."
					
					 He expressed deep condolences to Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo and staff members of his embassy and said words of consolation to them.
					
					 Upon hearing the news of the unexpected demise of Fidel Castro Ruz, the Korean people are overwhelmed with profound sorrow, he said, added that the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz is a great loss for the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries.
					
					 Saying that though Fidel Castro Ruz passed away, his noble feats will shine forever in the hearts of the peoples of the two countries and progressive mankind, he expressed belief that the revolutionary Cuban people would overcome the grief over the loss of their distinguished leader and certainly build a prospering ideal society of the people and win the victory of the socialist cause under the wise guidance of Raul Castro Ruz, true to the lifetime intention of Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 The Cuban ambassador expressed deep thanks to Kim Jong Un for visiting the Cuban embassy to share the sorrow of the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz with the Cuban embassy staff members.

articles.title: DPRK Officials Pay Condolence Visit to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
DPRK Officials Pay Condolence Visit to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Officials of military organ, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions of the DPRK visited the Cuban Embassy here on Tuesday to express condolences over the death of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 Laid before a photo of Fidel Castro Ruz were wreaths in the names of the Korean People's Army commanding officers and the central committees of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League, the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and the Socialist Women's Union of Korea, the Ministry of Culture, the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps and others.
					
					 The visitors paid a silent tribute to the deceased before making entries in the mourner's book.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Pay Condolence Visit to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Pay Condolence Visit to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Staff members of foreign embassies and international organization missions here visited the Cuban Embassy on Monday and Tuesday to express condolences over the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Inspects Mines and Enterprise in Area of Komdok
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Inspects Mines and Enterprise in Area of Komdok
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju toured the Taehung Youth Hero Mine, the Ryongyang Mine and the Komdok Mining Complex to learn about their production.
					 Going round mines and enterprise in the area of Komdok associated with the feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the premier encouraged their officials and workers in the efforts for productive success.
					
					 He stressed the need for those mines and enterprise to keep their facilities in full-capacity operation and put them on a modern basis in order to produce more minerals and thus become honorable victors in the 200-day campaign of loyalty to make a breakthrough in carrying out the five-year strategy for national economic development.
					
					 He also visited the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex and the Sangnong Mine.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Marks Romania's National Day
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Marks Romania's National Day
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition was opened at the Chollima Hall of Culture here Tuesday to mark the national day of Romania, in the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Romanian Embassy here and the DPRK-Romania Friendship Association.
					 Attending its opening ceremony were Vice-Chairman Ryu Kyong Il and members of the association, officials concerned, teachers and students of Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies, Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Romanian Embassy, and his embassy officials.
					
					 Present on invitation were staff members of embassies and international organization missions here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The participants looked round photos on display.

articles.title: Charge d'Affaires of Romanian Embassy Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Charge d'Affaires of Romanian Embassy Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Romanian Embassy here, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Tuesday to mark the national day of his country.
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK officials concerned and staff members of foreign embassies and international organization missions here.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Ministry of Culture Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Ministry of Culture Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Culture led by Minister Pak Chun Nam left here for Russia Tuesday to attend the Fifth International Cultural Forum to be held in Sankt-Peterburg.

articles.title: Swedish Delegation Here
articles.content:
Swedish Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Institute for Security and Development Policy of Sweden led by Director Niklas Swanstrom arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: WHO Official and His Party Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
WHO Official and His Party Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Oleg Chestnov, assistant director general of the World Health Organization, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They looked round mementoes preserved at the President's old home in Mangyongdae, being told that he spent his childhood there, nurturing his high ambition for revolution.
					
					 The guests also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Okryu Children's Hospital, the Puksae Polyclinic in Moranbong District of Pyongyang and other places.

articles.title: DPRK Beats U.S. in 2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Beats U.S. in 2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team advanced into finals of the 2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup.
					 It beat its American rival in the semi-finals.
					
					 At round 50 minutes No. 12 Jon So Yon succeeded a penalty shootout to gain one goal.
					
					 At one minute in the extra-time play No. 2 Sung Hyang Sim dribbled the ball into the penalty area of the U.S. side to kick it over to No. 9 Ri Hyang Sim who succeeded in the kick to gain the second goal.
					
					 As a result, the DPRK team beat the U.S. team 2:1.
					
					 The DPRK will play in the finals with the French team on Dec. 3.

articles.title: DPRK Doctorate Awarded to Overseas Compatriots
articles.content:
DPRK Doctorate Awarded to Overseas Compatriots
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK doctorate of history was conferred on Ri Kun and Kang Yong Su, Korean teachers at Yanbian University of China, with due ceremony at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 Those awardees newly clarified and systemized the academic issues related to the progress of sports activities of Korean nationals in Yanbian and the development of traditional handicraft art of the Korean nation and thus contributed to enriching the cultural heritages of the nation.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Returns
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Returns
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Japanese delegation for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism headed by Sakae Araki left here Tuesday.

articles.title: Isomeric Metal Terminal Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Isomeric Metal Terminal Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Material Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology succeeded in employing the FSW (friction stir welding) technology and developed new-type isomeric metal terminal.
					 In this regard, Kim Tae Hong, its developer, told KCNA:
					
					 Researchers made equipment and tools for FSW on their own efforts and established the process of producing isomeric metal terminal by ascertaining all technological parameters through computer simulations.
					
					 The new terminal is long in serviceable life and its contact resistance is no more than half, as compared with that of the import.
					
					 It can be processed with vertical milling machine and lathe.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Advises U.S. to Think with Reason
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Advises U.S. to Think with Reason 
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- There are politicians in the U.S. who have still an unrealistic way of thinking about the DPRK.
					 Antony Blinken, U.S. deputy secretary of State, claimed that "north Korea cannot be recognized as a nuclear weapons state and its access to nukes should not be allowed," negating the assertion made by the director of National Intelligence of the U.S. that the denuclearization of Korea is a failure.
					
					 In this regard an expert on Korean affairs in an article contributed to NK News said that the man styling himself a politician is still claiming Pyongyang's denuclearization to be the goal of the U.S. because of little experience in the Northeast Asian issue, adding that Blinken seems to live in the juvenile world.
					
					 This is jeering at the anachronistic and trite way of thinking of the man who has no elementary ability to face up to the reality.
					
					 It is long since the theory of "DPRK's possible dismantlement of its nukes" touted by the U.S. and some other countries went bust due to the world's recognition of the changed strategic position of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. and many other Western media which had taken a hostile approach towards the DPRK are giving wide publicity to the public demands for the earliest possible drop of the bankrupt hostile policy towards the DPRK, asserting that it is not necessary to expect north Korea to dismantle its nukes.
					
					 Recently Michael Hayden, former director of CIA, in an article contributed to the U.S. paper "The Hill" confessed to the fact about the denuclearization of Korea being an impossible goal was the view already unofficially shared among the U.S. intelligence authorities a decade ago. This created big sensation.
					
					 All these facts objectively prove that the U.S. finds itself in such tight corner that it has no choice but to change its strategic option.
					
					 It is great irony that Blinken is still sticking to the unrealistic way of thinking against this backdrop.
					
					 The completely failed policy towards the DPRK being a stark fact, it is not only foolish but an extremely dangerous option to persistently resort to the completely failed strategy.
					
					 The U.S. should not persist in something impossible.
					
					 The successive U.S. administrations from Truman to Obama have squandered funds running into astronomical figures for pursuing their policy to stifle the DPRK for several decades. The U.S. needs to seriously reflect on what it gained from such policy.
					
					 The pig-headed stand of persistently denying the strategic position of the full-fledged nuclear power in the East would only result in impairing the position of the superpower tight-cornered over the Korean issue.
					
					 Washington would be well advised to face up to the reality.
					
					 It can take a wise option only when it proceeds from a realistic way of thinking.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Sinister Aims Sought by U.S. Master and Its S. Korean Servants in THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Sinister Aims Sought by U.S. Master and Its S. Korean Servants in THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Days ago the Chinese Huan Qui network posted an article titled "Can THAAD save Park Geun Hye regime from jaw of death?"
					 The article said that the Park Geun Hye group, hit hard from all sides, is desperately pushing forward THAAD deployment and concluded an agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan in a bid to divert elsewhere the public attention and get breathing spell. However it is naive to try to escape death by doing so, it noted, adding that south Korea's bid to depend on the U.S. THAAD or the agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan will aggravate antagonism in Northeast Asia and hurt others and itself.
					
					 Commenting on it, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says:
					
					 This is a reasonable comment.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is getting so zealous in the moves to push forward the deployment of THAAD in south Korea not because of her own viewpoint or any principle.
					
					 South Korea is a colony of modern version which has to get approval from the U.S. when the former wants to do anything. Having no sovereignty, everything in south Korea is controlled by the U.S. Not only policy making but also fund spending should be okayed by the U.S. The successive "presidents" of south Korea had played the role of a puppet of the U.S. Traitor Park Geun Hye is no exception. 
					
					 It is self-evident that Park Geun Hye cannot introduce THAAD into south Korea as she pleases as it rattles the nerves of neighboring countries. 
					
					 THAAD deployment in south Korea is pursuant to the U.S. military strategy to contain the potential rivals in the region by force of arms and dominate the world.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that Park Geun Hye is nothing but a political puppet of the U.S., which is wire-pulling her behind the scene.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is busy "seeking a way for improving the human rights performance in the north." 
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article:
					
					 Recently Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister, and Hong Yong Phyo, puppet minister of Unification, met with the UN special rapporteur in Seoul and staged an anti-DPRK "human rights" burlesque.
					
					 Yun and Hong begged for "close cooperation," pulling up the DPRK over the "quality of residents' life" and crying out for "improved human rights performance."
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group are brazen-faced enough to go reckless in such a smear campaign against  the DPRK over the "human rights" issue though they are fated to go to graves of history right now for having turned south Korea into the worst tundra of human rights and cesspool of scandals.
					
					 The above-said campaign is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those driven to desperation by the spectacular successes made by the DPRK through the enforcement of popular policies.
					
					 It is a trite method of the successive puppet rulers of south Korea to more desperately resort to the racket for confrontation with the DPRK when their doomsday is drawing near.
					
					 The frantic anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign kicked off by the puppet regime in collusion with foreign forces is designed to cover up the awful human rights situation in south Korea and divert elsewhere the people's bitter criticism in a bid to prolong its remaining days. 
					
					 There is no place on this land for Park and her group to survive as they dare hurt the ideology and social system of the DPRK and the dignity of its supreme leadership.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Praises Feats of Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Praises Feats of Fidel Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday carries an article on the demise of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 It says:
					
					 Upon hearing this sad news, the Korean people are overcome with deep sorrow together with the revolutionary Cuban people and expressing deep condolences to the party, government and people of Cuba and the bereaved families over his demise.
					
					 His demise is a great loss to the Cuban people and the progressives of the world struggling for socialism and justice.
					
					 Fidel Castro Ruz is a revolutionary fighter as he built the first socialist system in the Western Hemisphere of the earth and devoted his whole life to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness.
					
					 The shining successes the Cuban people have made in socialist construction are directly linked with his name.
					
					 He was an outstanding revolutionary who achieved the victory of the Cuban revolution by waging a bloody struggle with arms in hand in his early years.
					
					 The courageous Cuban people built a socialist state in the Western Hemisphere of the earth under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz, a great revolutionary produced by the Cuban people. 
					
					 He bolstered up the national defence capability and dynamically pushed ahead with the socialist revolution and socialist construction, radically changing the appearance of the country despite the U.S. imperialists' vicious aggression, interference and blockade. 
					
					 The victory of the Cuban revolution and the eye-opening changes that took place in the land of Cuba would have been unthinkable without the arduous armed struggle and unerring leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 The Cuban people will always remember this and surely build a prosperous ideal society of the people and achieve the victory of the socialist cause, true to his lifetime intention.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Red Herring
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Red Herring
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, south Korean puppet Minister of Defense Han Min Gu went to Yonphyong Island where he blustered that "northwestern islands are where the south and the north stand in acute confrontation", "the north's provocation should never be allowed" and "strong counteractions should be taken to defend the northwestern islands".  Puppet warmongers staged firing drills of self-propelled artillery pieces and missiles in the hot spot waters in the West Sea under the pretext of coping with "provocation from the north" at the exact time when shelling took place six years ago, kicking up war hysteria.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary terms this a reckless act of dolts who are working hard to mislead the public opinion demanding the ouster of Park Geun Hye and give her breathing spell by leading the DPRK to a military counteraction. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Park group stuck in the abyss of ruin are seeking a way out in kicking up a racket over "security crisis," while raising a hue and cry over "possible provocation from the north" and staging dangerous saber-rattling.
					
					 The puppet brass hats zealously hurl soldiers into military adventures against compatriots in the north and get frantic with war drills targeting the north, trumpeting about "deliberate and calculated possibility of tactical provocation" and crying out for "prompt punishment". This, however, only reveals their cynical ploy to give traitor Park and her group breathing spell, being hit hard from all sides for confrontation with compatriots and military provocations.
					
					 The puppet group of traitors is running helter-skelter, obsessed with daydream, but no one in the world would be surprised by the last-ditch efforts of the doomed.

articles.title: Day of First General Strike and Citizens' Disobedience Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Day of First General Strike and Citizens' Disobedience Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The people's emergency action to oust the Park Geun Hye regime called a press conference at the hall of the Confederation of Trade Unions in Seoul on Nov. 28, at which it declared Nov. 30 as "Day of the first general strike and citizens' disobedience", according to the south Korean online paper Tongil News.
					 The organization said that all citizens across south Korea on Nov. 30 would give up their work and take part in the general strike and other actions demanding Park Geun Hye's resignation and hold candlelight rallies in each province and city, timed to coincide with a large-scale candlelight meeting to be held at the plaza of Kwanghwamun in Seoul in the evening.
					
					 A declaration on "Day of the first general strike and citizens' disobedience" was read out at the conference.
					
					 The declaration said it is a humiliation for Park Geun Hye to prolong her remaining days in power though she finds herself in the abyss of ruin and it is a bitter disgrace to the poulation.
					
					 We will surely bring the Park Geun Hye regime to the scaffold of history, through two million-people candlelight resistance, general strike and citizens' disobedience, it stated.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Calls for All-out Strike against Park
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Calls for All-out Strike against Park
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The people's emergency action to oust the Park Geun Hye regime issued an appeal on Nov. 28 on the occasion of "Day of the first general strike and citizens' disobedience", according to the south Korean online paper Tongil News.
					 The appeal called upon all the inhabitants to take part in the general strike and the struggle of citizens' disobedience urging the prompt resignation of traitor Park with stronger resistance on Nov. 30.

articles.title: Taejon Citizens of S. Korea Stage Actions for Ousting Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Taejon Citizens of S. Korea Stage Actions for Ousting Park Geun Hye
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Taejon citizens of south Korea held their second rally in demand of Park Geun Hye's resignation on Nov. 26 as part of the 5th all-people action, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 More than 40 000 citizens took part in the rally, chanting slogan "Park Geun Hye, Step Down."
					
					 Speakers there stressed that the movement for ousting Park is a patriotic movement to set right the wrong politics and defend justice.
					
					 And they accused the "Saenuri Party", tycoons, the prosecution, the police, the U.S. and Japan of helping the Park group stay in power. 
					
					 To oust the Park regime is the only way to scrap all policies enforced by the present regime and eliminate the masterminds of scandals, they contended.

articles.title: S. Korean KBS Reports about Park Geun Hye's Poor Position
articles.content:
S. Korean KBS Reports about Park Geun Hye's Poor Position
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean KBS on Nov. 25 and 28 reported about traitor Park Geun Hye being attacked on all sides. 
					 It said that 40 lawmakers from the "Saenuri Party" signed the approval for impeachment of Park Geun Hye.
					
					 Furthermore, the minister of Justice and the chief secretary of Chongwadae for civil administration expressed their resignations, it said, adding:
					
					 In particular, sudden expression of resignation by Choe Jae Gyong, recently appointed as chief secretary for civil administration, was a serious strike at the "president".
					
					 The paralysis of "administration" owing to the "Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil scandal" has now lasted for a month.

articles.title: S. Koreans' Action for Bringing down Park Geun Hye Hailed
articles.content:
S. Koreans' Action for Bringing down Park Geun Hye Hailed
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Japan met in Tokyo on Nov. 26 to accuse Park Geun Hye and express full support for the south Korean people's struggle for her resignation from office.
					 Present at the meeting were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of Chongryon, officials of organizations and enterprises under Chongryon, officials of Chongryon and compatriots of various circles in Kanto and delegates of teaching staff and students of the Korean University.
					
					 The participants watched a video showing the south Korean people's struggle against Park Geun Hye.
					
					 Nam Sung U said in a report that the struggles against Park Geun Hye now staged in across south Korea are an eruption of anger at her who has only sought dictatorship, irregularities and corruption, sycophancy and national division and a just action for forcing her to step down and throwing her into the dumping ground of history at any cost.
					
					 The reporter condemned Park for pressing for the blitz conclusion of an agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan which any successive puppet rulers dared not do.
					
					 Adopted at the meeting was a joint statement of Koreans in Japan to denounce Park Geun Hye and fully support the south Korean people's struggle for her resignation.
					
					 The meeting decided to send the joint statement to organizations of overseas compatriots in Russia, China, the U.S., Canada, Germany, Australia and other parts of the world and thus develop it into a joint statement of overseas Koreans under their support and hand it to the puppet embassies.
					
					 It also decided to develop a "signature-collection campaign for forcing Park Geun Hye to step down" into a mass movement involving all Koreans in Japan together with the Federation of Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye of S. Korea Blamed by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye of S. Korea Blamed by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Song Mi, chairwoman of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the Federation of Young Korean Nationals in China, issued an article titled "End of Park Geun Hye, national shame and rare political fraud" on Nov. 25.
					 The article noted that various circles of south Korea are now urging Park Geun Hye to step down.
					
					 Steadfast is the south Korean people's will to make a thoroughgoing investigation into Park's crimes and sternly judge her group, it said, demanding that traitor Park Geun Hye step down at once and appear in the court.

articles.title: South Koreans' Struggle for Park Geun Hye's Resignation Supported Worldwide
articles.content:
South Koreans' Struggle for Park Geun Hye's Resignation Supported Worldwide
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans reportedly held rallies across the world on Nov. 26 in support of the south Korean people's 5th all-people action urging the resignation of Park Geun Hye.
					 The participants in a rally held in Paris of France condemned traitor Park Geun Hye for going against the people's demand for her resignation.
					
					 Similar rallies took place in major cities of Germany.
					
					 A mass on the situation was held in Rome of Italy in demand of Park Geun Hye's resignation while more than 100 south Korean civilians and students had a meeting in Brussels of Belgium.
					
					 Such meetings or rallies were reported in 53 cities across the world.

articles.title: British Organization Introduces Kim Jong Un's Letter
articles.content:
British Organization Introduces Kim Jong Un's Letter
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on Nov. 22 posted on its website "Let Us Further Intensify the Work of the Women's Union under the Banner of Modelling the Whole Society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism", a letter sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un to those attending the Sixth Congress of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea.
					 The work, published on Nov. 17, Juche 105 (2016), says that the Korean women's movement is a Juche-based movement which was pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and has covered a glorious course of its development under the guidance of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 And it clarifies the tasks and ways for the union to make positive contributions to accomplishing the cause of socialism and Juche revolution.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A Nakhodka City, Russia, committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated on Nov. 23.
					 Zelenov, first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Maritime Territory of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The remembrance committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary life and exploits on the 5th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Italy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Italy
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- An Italian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Rome on Nov. 25.
					 Alfonso Galdi, director of the International Department of the Communist Party of Italy, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il and organize political and cultural events for support to the Korean people stepping up the building of a thriving socialist power, closely rallied around supreme leader Kim Jong Un, from Nov. 26 to late Dec.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Moldova
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Moldova
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the committee for remembering the great leader Kim Jong Il was held in Tiraspol on Nov. 23 under the co-sponsorship of the Moldovan Songun Youth Union for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Pridnestrovye Anti-Imperialism Songun Revolutionary Association for the Study of the Juche Idea of Moldova.
					 Aleksei Bolynets, chairman of the above-said association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events on the 5th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Laud Leader Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Laud Leader Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Swiss preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on November 20 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's inspection of Panmunjom.
					 Recalling that Generalissimo Kim Jong Il inspected Panmunjom on Nov. 24. 1996, the statement said:
					
					 He visited a forefront military post in the most dangerous hotspot of the Korean peninsula and showed his firm will for national reunification.
					
					 Looking at the monument inscribed with President Kim Il Sung's last signature on a document related to the issue of national reunification, he recalled the devoted efforts made by the President for the reunification of the country and stressed the need to hand down a reunified country to the posterity at any cost.
					
					 His historic inspection of Panmunjom, where U.S. admitted its defeat in the Korean War by signing the Armistice Agreement in 1953, dealt a telling blow at the arrogant U.S. imperialists once again.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un expresa el pesar por deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz en embajada cubana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un expresa el pesar por deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz en embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito el dia 28 la embajada cubana en Corea con motivo del fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana, y expreso el profundo sentido de condolencias.
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC y Kim Kye Gwan, primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores.
					
					Estaba depositada la ofrenda floral enviada por Kim Jong Un.
					
					El Presidente guardo un momento de silencio junto con los funcionarios acompanantes en memoria de Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					En el libro de condolencias escribio como lo siguiente:
					
					"Aunque fallecio el destacado dirigente, su nombre y proezas se quedaran eternamente en la memoria de todos nosotros.
					
					Con el dolor de la perdida de un gran camarada, gran companero de armas
					
					Kim Jong Un"
					
					El Comandante Supremo del EPC expreso el gran pesame al embajador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo y otros miembros de la embajada cubana en Corea.
					
					Dijo que el pueblo coreano, informado de la noticia sobre el inesperado deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana, esta lleno de gran tristeza y anadio que su fallecimiento deviene una gran perdida para los partidos, gobiernos y pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					Expuso la conviccion de que el pueblo cubano revolucionario superara el dolor por la perdida de su desatado lider y lograra sin falta la construccion de una prospera sociedad ideal del pueblo y la victoria de la causa socialista en acato al proposito de Fidel Castro Ruz en su existencia bajo la sabia direccion de Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					El embajador cubano Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo expreso el profundo agradecimiento al Presidente Kim Jong Un quien visito la embajada cubana para compartir junto con los cubanos la tristeza por la perdida de Fidel Castro Ruz.

articles.title: Funcionarios coreanos visitan embajada cubana en RPDC
articles.content:
Funcionarios coreanos visitan embajada cubana en RPDC
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los funcionarios de los organos de las fuerzas armadas, las organizaciones de masas, los ministerios y las instituciones centrales visitaron el dia 29 la embajada cubana en la RPDC con motivo del fallecimiento del companero Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana, y expresaron condolencias.
					Fueron depositadas al pie de la foto de Fidel Castro Ruz las ofrendas florales a nombre de los miembros de mando del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el CC de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista, el CC de la FGSC, el CC de la UTAC, el CC de la Union Socialista de Mujeres de Corea, el Ministerio de Cultura, la Direccion General de Trabajo con el Cuerpo Diplomatico, etc. 
					
					Los visitantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del lider cubano fallecido y firmaron el libro de condolencias.

articles.title: Extranjeros en RPDC expresan condolencias al deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Extranjeros en RPDC expresan condolencias al deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas y de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, expresaron condolencias los dias 28 y 29 en la embajada de la Republica de Cuba en la RPDC por el fallecimiento del companero Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre minas y complejo de la zona de Komdok
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre minas y complejo de la zona de Komdok
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju averiguo en el terreno el estado de produccion de la Mina Heroina Juventud de Taehung, la Mina de Ryongyang y el Complejo Minero de Komdok. 
					Recorriendo esas entidades donde estan impregnadas las huellas de orientacion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el premier estimulo la lucha de los funcionarios y obreros que registran exitos en la produccion bien conscientes de la importancia de sus tareas. 
					
					Les exhorto a ser triunfadores orgullosos en la campana de 200 dias de fidelidad para abrir la brecha de cumplimiento de la estrategia quinquenal para el desarrollo de la economia nacional al lograr el aumento de produccion de minerales mediante el pleno funcionamiento de equipos y la modernizacion. 
					
					Por otra parte, Pak Pong Ju visito el Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang y la Mina de Sangnong.
